pageTitle: Sunderland A.F.C. - Bruce lands Hull City post
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {15863=Time: 2:43PM, 10257=FSF Urge Clubs To Reduce Away Ticket Prices (Friday July 17 2015), 18618=As expected, former Sunderland boss Steve Bruce has been appointed as Hull City manager. The former Black Cats boss was sacked last November and replaced by Martin O'Neill. Bruce has been out the game since and was offered the Tiger's job earlier in the week. The Allam family who own Hull City had sacked previous boss Nicky Barmby after comments he made in the media after the 2012/13 season budget. Formerly of Wigan Athletic (twice), Crystal Palace, Sheffield United, Birmingham City and Huddersfield Town, Bruce will be formally unveiled this afternoon at a press conference, having agreed a three-year contract at the KC Stadium. Hull finished in eighth place in last season's n.Power Championship standings. Good luck Steve., 10868=Defoe On The Mark For Black Cats (Thursday July 23 2015), 9424=Sunderland Complete Dutch International Signing. (Thursday July 16 2015), 10668=Players To Come And Go At S-o-L (Wednesday July 22 2015), 10048=Kaboul Set For Switch To Sunderland. (Thursday July 16 2015), 9625=Santiago Vergini Heads For Spain. (Friday July 17 2015)}
